intro: Neltuma calingastana, commonly known as the Calingasta neltuma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and high-altitude environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Neltuma calingastana is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its cultural significance in local communities.
